title: Geographical Location
description: Tuna El-Gebel is located west of Mallawi City, on the western edge of the Nile Valley. It is characterized by its desert location, which contributed to the preservation of its archaeological remains.

title: Historical Significance
description: Tuna El-Gebel served as the necropolis for the city of Hermopolis during the Greco-Roman period. It was renowned as a place dedicated to the worship of the god Thoth, the Egyptian deity of wisdom and writing.

title: Archaeological Discoveries
description: Many artifacts have been unearthed, such as statues, mummies, and pottery. The site is a treasure trove of information about daily life and funerary customs in ancient Egypt.

title: Touristic Importance
description: Tuna El-Gebel is a significant destination for history and archaeology enthusiasts. Visiting with a tour guide is recommended to understand the site's history and explore its key landmarks.

tips.one: Wear comfortable clothes and suitable shoes for walking in the desert environment.

tips.two: Carry water and sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun during your visit.
